sen.e: Fuyusuke SHONI (date of birth unknown – September 22, 1375) was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan).

sen.j: 冬資が当主を務めていた頃、九州では菊池氏や懐良親王などの南朝 (日本)勢力が台頭し、北朝 (日本)勢力、すなわち幕府側の勢力は押されていた。
sen.e: When Fuyusuke was the head of the Shoni clan, the Southern Court (Japan) in Kyushu which included the Kikuchi clan and the imperial prince, Kanenaga Shino, was gaining power while the Northern Court (Japan), which was the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), was losing power.

sen.j: このため冬尚は大友氏や島津氏と協力して南朝勢力と戦う一方で、幕府から新たな九州探題を派遣してくれるように要請していた。
sen.e: For this reason, while Fuyusuke was fighting against the Southern Court's power, he was making a request to the bakufu to send him Kyushu Tandai (a local commissioner for Kyushu).

sen.j: 時の将軍・足利義満はこれに応じて1371年、今川貞世（了俊）を探題として送り込んだ。
sen.e: Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA, the shogun of the period, accepted the request and sent Sadayo (Ryoshun) IMAGAWA as a tandai (a local commissioner).

sen.j: 貞世のもとで1372年から反攻に転じた幕府勢力は、徐々に南朝勢力を駆逐した。
sen.e: Under Sadayo's command since 1372, the Bakufu's force made a counterattack against the Southern Court's power and gradually started driving them back. In 1374, the force tried to expel the Southern Court in one push but Fuyusuke did not send Sadayo a reinforcement as their relationship was not good at that time.

sen.j: しかしこのため、貞世に南朝側と内通していると猜疑され、翌年に冬資は貞世によって謀殺されてしまったのであった（水島の変）。
sen.e: Because of the bad relationship, Sadayo had a suspicion that Fuyusuke was communicating secretly with the Southern Court, and the following year he had him executed (Mizushima Incident).

sen.e: After Fuyusuke's death, Yorizumi SHONI succeeded him as the head of the SHONI clan and stood up to Sadayo by joining the Southern Court.
